question_content.description: Directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A, B, C and D. Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet I with a single line through the centre.

questions.description1: Questions 1 to 4 are based on the conversation you have just heard.

content.A: It focuses exclusively on jazz.
content.B: It sponsors major jazz concerts.
content.C: It has several branches in London.
content.D: It displays albums by new music talents.

content.A: It originated with cowboys.
content.B: Its market has now shrunk.
content.C: Its listeners are mostly young people.
content.D: It remains as widespread as hip-hop music.

content.A: Its definition is varied and complicated.
content.B: It is still going through experimentation.
content.C: It is frequently accompanied by singing.
content.D: Its style has remained largely unchanged.

content.A: Learn to play them.
content.B: Take music lessons.
content.C: Listen to them yourself.
content.D: Consult jazz musicians.

questions.description1: Questions 5 to 8 are based on the conversation you have just heard.

content.A: She paid her mortgage.
content.B: She called on the man.
content.C: She made a business plan.
content.D: She went to the bank.

content.A: Her previous debt hadn't been cleared yet.
content.B: Her credit history was considered poor.
content.C: She had apparently asked for too much.
content.D: She didn't pay her mortgage in time.

content.A: Pay a debt long overdue.
content.B: Buy a piece of property.
content.C: Start her own business.
content.D: Check her credit history.

content.A: Seek advice from an expert about fundraising.
content.B: Ask for smaller loans from different lenders.
content.C: Build up her own finances step by step.
content.D: Revise her business proposal carefully.

question_content.description: Directions: In this section, you will hear two passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A, B, C and D. Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

content.A: It is profitable and environmentally friendly.

content.A: It saves at lot of electricity.
content.B: It needs little maintenance.
content.C: It causes hardly any pollution.
content.D: It loosens soil while weeding.

content.A: It has turned certain insects into a new food source.

content.C: It has imported some exotic foods from overseas.
content.D: It has joined hands with Sainsbury 's to sell pet insects.

content.A: It was really unforgettable.
content.B: It was a pleasant surprise.
content.C: It hurt his throat slightly.

content.A: They are more tasty than beef, chicken or pork.
content.B: They are more nutritious than soups and salads.

content.D: They will son pain popularity throughout the world.

question_content.description: Directions: In this section, you will hear three recordings of lectures or talks followed by three or four questions. The recordings will be played only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A, B, C and D. Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

questions.description1: Questions 16 to 18 are based on the recording you have just heard.

content.A: To categorize different types of learners.
content.B: To find out what students prefer to learn.
content.C: To understand the mechanism of the human brain.
content.D: To see if they are inherent traits affecting learning.

content.A: It was defective.
content.B: It was misguided.
content.C: It was original in design.
content.D: It was thought-provoking.

content.A: Auditory aids are as important as visual aids.
content.B: Visual aids are helpful to all types of learners.
content.C: Reading plain texts is more effective than viewing pictures.
content.D: Scientific concepts are hard to understand without visual aids.

content.A: Not playing a role in a workplace revolution.

content.B: The balance of power in the workplace would change.
content.C: Technological advances would create many new jobs.
content.D: Most workers could afford to have a house of their own.

content.A: Loss of workers' personal dignity.
content.B: Deprivation of workers' creativity.
content.C: Deterioration of workers' mental health.

content.D: Problems of different kinds kept popping up.

content.B: All kinds of equipment gets rusted.
content.C: I luge maintenance costs accumulate.
content.D: Complaints by local residents increase.

question_content.description: Directions： In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

questions.description1: Questions 1 and 2 are based on the news report you have just heard.

content.A: The number of male nurses has gone down.
content.B: There is discrimination against male nurses.
content.C: There is a growing shortage of medical personnel.
content.D: The number of nurses has dropped to a record low.

content.A: Working conditions.
content.B: Educational system.
content.C: Inadequate pay.
content.D: Cultural bias.

questions.description1: Questions 3 and 4 are based on the news report you have just heard.

content.A: He fell out of a lifeboat.
content.B: He was almost drowned.
content.C: He lost his way on a beach.
content.D: He enjoyed swimming in the sea.

content.A: The lifeboats patrol the area round the clock.
content.B: The beach is a good place to watch the tide.
content.C: The emergency services are efficient.
content.D: The beach is a popular tourist resort.

questions.description1: Questions 5 to 7 are based on the news report you have just heard.

content.A: It climbed 25 storeys at one go.
content.B: It broke into an office room.
content.C: It escaped from a local zoo.
content.D: It became an online star.

content.A: Release it into the wild.
content.B: Return it to its owner.
content.C: Send it back to the zoo.
content.D: Give it a physical checkup.

content.A: A racoon can perform acts no human can.
content.B: A racoon can climb much higher than a cat.
content.C: The racoon did something no politician could.
content.D: The raccoon became as famous as some politicians.

content.A: She received a bonus unexpectedly.

content.A: He has just too many things to attend to.
